title: Reporting Verbs 1
description: Make a new sentence with the same meaning using the reporting verb in brackets.

parts.value: "You shouldn't go into the water" said the coast guard. (advise against)

parts.answer: The coast guard advised against going into the water.
answerList: The coast guard advised against going into the water.

parts.value: "I'll go to France on holiday" said John. (decide, using infinitive)

parts.answer: John decided to go to France on holiday.
answerList: John decided to go to France on holiday.

parts.value: "I think you should go to the dentist" Julie said to Tom. (advise, using infinitive)

parts.answer: Julie advised Tom to go to the dentist.
answerList: Julie advised Tom to go to the dentist.

parts.value: "Watch out for the weak bridge" he said. (warn, using 'about')

parts.answer: He warned us about the weak bridge.
answerList: He warned us about the weak bridge.

parts.value: "You should apply for the job" said Jack to Stella. (encourage)

parts.answer: Jack encouraged Stella to apply for the job.
answerList: Jack encouraged Stella to apply for the job.

parts.value: "Okay, Keiko can go to the party" said Keiko's mum. (agree, using clause)

parts.answer: Keiko's mum agreed that Keiko could go to the party.
answerList: Keiko's mum agreed that Keiko could go to the party.
Keiko's mum agreed Keiko could go to the party.

parts.value: "The class will start later on Tuesdays" said the teacher to us. (explain + clause)

parts.answer: The teacher explained to us that the class would start later on Tuesdays.
answerList: The teacher explained to us that the class would start later on Tuesdays.
The teacher explained to us the class would start later on Tuesdays.

parts.value: "It's a great idea to go to the beach" said Maria. (recommend + verb-ing)

parts.answer: Maria recommended going to the beach.
answerList: Maria recommended going to the beach.

parts.value: "Don't cross the road there" she said to the children. (warn, using infinitive)

parts.answer: She warned the children not to cross the road there.
answerList: She warned the children not to cross the road there.

parts.value: "I'll make the coffee!" said David. (insist + on)

parts.answer: David insisted on making the coffee.
answerList: David insisted on making the coffee.

parts.value: "I'll study really hard for the exam" said Luke. (promise + to + infinitive)

parts.answer: Luke promised to study really hard for the exam.
answerList: Luke promised to study really hard for the exam.

parts.value: "This is where the station is" said Klara. (explain, using question word + clause)

parts.answer: Klara explained where the station was.
answerList: Klara explained where the station was.

parts.value: "Right, let's buy the car in the morning!" we said. (agree + infinitive)

parts.answer: We agreed to buy the car in the morning.
answerList: We agreed to buy the car in the morning.

parts.value: "Don't forget that Lucy needs to go to the dentist" she said to me. (remind, using clause)

parts.answer: She reminded me that Lucy needed to go to the dentist.
answerList: She reminded me that Lucy needed to go to the dentist.
She reminded me Lucy needed to go to the dentist.

parts.value: "How about having Indian food?" I said. (suggest, using verb-ing)

parts.answer: I suggested having Indian food.
answerList: I suggested having Indian food.

parts.value: "I'll be early" I said to my mother. (promise + clause)

parts.answer: I promised my mother that I would be early.
answerList: I promised my mother that I would be early.
I promised my mother I would be early.

parts.value: "I'm sorry I forgot your birthday" said Amanda to me. (apologise)

parts.answer: Amanda apologised for forgetting my birthday.
answerList: Amanda apologised for forgetting my birthday.

parts.value: "I'll leave at six pm!" John said. (decide + clause)

parts.answer: John decided that he would leave at six pm.
answerList: John decided that he would leave at six pm.
John decided he would leave at six pm.

parts.value: "This is how we use the present perfect" said Amy. (explain + question word + infinitive)

parts.answer: Amy explained how to use the present perfect.
answerList: Amy explained how to use the present perfect.

parts.value: "Don't forget to buy milk!" said Antonio to Lucia. (remind, using infinitive)

parts.answer: Antonio reminded Lucia to buy milk.
answerList: Antonio reminded Lucia to buy milk.
